comments.commentBody:
There is a rose in Spanish Harlem
A red rose up in Spanish Harlem
It is a special one, it's never seen the sun
It only comes out when the moon is on the run
And all the stars are gleaming
It's growing in the street right up through the concrete
But soft and sweet and dreamin'

There is a rose in Spanish Harlem
A red rose up in Spanish Harlem
With eyes as black as coal that look down in my soul
And starts a fire there and then I lose control
I have to beg your pardon
I'm going to pick that rose and watch her as she grows in my garden
I'm going to pick that rose and watch her as she grows in my garden

(There is a rose in Spanish Harlem)
La-la-la, la-la-la, la-la-la-la
(There is a rose in Spanish Harlem)
La-la-la, la-la-la, la-la-la-la
(There is a rose in Spanish Harlem)

http://terryreport.com

Lieber was a tremendous talent and architect of modern pop and soul whose records provided a soundtrack to my youth as I appropriated my parents' records.  One editorial note: Mr. Sill's first name was Lester, not Leonard.

Sarkozy did a Senior Bush and Strauss Kahn paid the price. Of course, Sarkozy accomplished that with a little help from his friends across the pond. Everything about this case has the stink of an orchestrated conspiracy. The case was booked as if in a hurry, pulling a dignitary off the plane at the last moment. Then the prosecutor- Vance Jr.- went around blathering that it is an open and shut case. American and American sponsored correspondentswrote numerous columns (suddenly, and all these years they kept quiet?) how Kahn used to womanize during IMF meetings everywhere. Now, here is the clincher: Within 48 hours and no more of Christine Lagarde, a protégé of Sarkozy, ascended to the post of IMF chief, the case against Kahn began crumbling, and he is a free man today. No Conspiracy? Not against someone who might have issues with American hegemony like Jacques Chirac did? Not against Kahn who is less corporatist than Sarkozy, and he is tipped to be a heavy favorite to be the next president of an important ally?

Sarkozy has been extremely unpopular over the last several months. He might have or might not have lost the election. But all politicians suffer from a bout of paranoid attacks aka the Watergate flu every now and then. Also explains the gamble he took in rushing into Libya. If it did not pay off, French people would have crucified him anyway. He might ride a wave of popularity as Libya's liberator for sometime but as in the case of Dubya's Dad, Greece and Italy together could topple Sarkozy's apple cart after all.

Remember “it’s the economy stupid?”? 1992? Remember April Glaspie the scapegoat?

For all you folks stating that it reduces HIV/AIDS and STD's in both males and females....are you serious??? I'll say it again. Are you serious??? Let me tell you a little secret. The U.S. has the highest rate of circ'd men and also the highest rate of STD's. Hmmmmm. Do you get it? If not, what that means is if circumcision reduced the rate of STD's we wouldn't have the HIGHEST rate of STD's. Still don't get it??? Here's a tip: The best way to prevent STD's is to WEAR A CONDOM.
Still don't get it? Amputating healthy, functioning body parts (the prepuce contains OVER 20,000 fine touch nerve endings, the majority of the WORLD is intact, the majority of baby boys in the U.S. is intact) as a preventative medical practice ISN'T MODERN MEDICINE. Open a History book. We used to amputate body parts as preventative medicine back when genital cutting was proposed as a means to cure blindness and deafness. Seriously, some of these comments are beyond ignorant. Read a book. It doesn't take a rocket scientist.

In 1979, when I had my son, I had the same dilemma. How, after a "gentle" birth, could I have a doctor remove a healthy part of my son's body? It made no sense, even though my heritage is Jewish. My father was alarmed at first, but he got over it. I know I made the right choice to leave my son intact. Circumcision sounds barbaric, when you think about it. And traumatic for the baby. We can't remove parts of our children's bodies for such sketchy reasons. There was once a doctor who wrote a book saying baby girls should have their breasts removed to eliminate the possibility of cancer. No sane person would do that. Why would we cut up our baby boys?
Can't help wondering if S&P was set up by Fitch and Moody's. Paranoid...but sweet!
These three aren't too bad on the field either.

Science reporting in NYT is almost always terrific. Thanks for another interesting piece!
There are so many cool things in this world! :)
Pink Floyd, the Salt Lake flamingo, also showed up periodically at Red Rocks Lakes in Montana.  Claiming to have seen a flamingo in Montana is akin to claiming to have been abducted by a UFO.

I saw Ashford & Simpson at a benefit a few years ago - they only did that one song (Ain't No Mountain...), and half the audience leapt up and started dancing. We couldn't help it!

Groove on, Nick!
xxx

Dab,
Maybe you haven't heard, but teachers no longer have the autonomy to make decisions that benefit their "clients". As for your condescending portrayal of other (non-teacher)professionals as beacons of altruism, this smacks of a kind of vocational bigotry. The vast majority of other professionals I know don't do any pro-bono work. Conversely, I can personally attest to the fact that multitudes of teachers go way beyond the call of duty. Finally, please cite an example of a profession where the professional livelihoods of the members depend on the attainment of arbitrary and completely unrealistic "outcomes", and I'll show you a profession with disproportionate, if not rampant cheating. I can't believe that you are so naieve as to think otherwise.
Nick left a musical legacy.  He will be remembered and dearly missed.  Valerie and Nick brought me many hours of joy.  They lifted my spirits when I was down.  RIP!
Gosh, I hate to see that Nick Ashford has passed. I also cannot wrap my mind around him being 70 years old either!

Babe, Jailhouse Rock was conceived for the Presley picture entitled "The Rock' in March of 1957 in a NYC hotel room. Leiber and Stoller actually wrote 3 songs for the film in 4 hours after Elvis' music publisher put in a sofa in front of their hotel room door and told them to write.  Needless to say, the song was killer on Elvis' voice and had to be spliced from two separate takes.
I think it's great that he lived to be 78.  He might have died at 45 or 33 1/3!
People who compare male circumcision to female genital mutilation are just ignorant. This is no longer called "female circumcision" by knowledgeable people. Do your research!

After all the pain, misinformation, withering accusations etc. caused by the first report, it is incredible to learn that only individuals from homosexual organizations were used in the sample.  That would be like only sampling Republicans who identified themselves as also being independents to determine what the views of all independents were.  This seems to me to be a case of gross academic negligence.
I notice that all of the several detainees shown captured by the rebels seem to be black Africans rather than Arabs.  What gives?
The tobacco industry is conscienceless.
Whenever I remember Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbee, Scotland, I can only say Good Riddance to a monumental murderer and tyrant.
Brilliant juxtaposition in the video.  Exxon reassuring us that off-shore drilling is incredibly safe, and Khadafi's son reassuring us that Libya is at peace.

I'm  a goy born in 1931 and circumcised as was common among the middle class at the time. Plus, my mom was an R.N. and up on the current medical advice. I've never had any problem with it. When I  went to a country school in Oklahoma in the 1940s all of the other boys were uncircumcised. Once when I was with a Jewish lady in Europe she noticed and said, "Oh, I didn't know you were a landsman."
Good songs, Mr. Leiber.

Together with Valerie, Nick was one of the great song-writers of his generation.  His performances were full of an infectious energy that always made me smile.  His songs were positive affirmations that the human spirit could lift either one soul or the entire world when needed. Rest in peace, Nick.
Rest easy, Nick. Sincerest condolences to Valerie. A love song-writing team second to none.  Sorry to hear that one half of the best is gone.
